articles.headline: Testing for Joy and Grit? Schools Nationwide Push to Measure Students’ Emotional Skills
articles.snippet: In a closely watched experiment, students in California are being tested on their social-emotional skills; the results will be used to rate schools.
articles.abstract: In a closely watched experiment, students in California are being tested on their social-emotional skills; the results will be used to rate schools.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The fifth graders in Jade Cooney’s classroom compete against a kitchen timer during lessons to see how long they can sustain good behavior — raising hands, disagreeing respectfully and looking one another in the eye — without losing time to insults or side conversations.

articles.headline: ‘Brexit’ Vote and Donald Trump’s Surge Reflect Discontent
articles.snippet: The outcome of Britain’s June 23 referendum is murky, but moves toward more extreme solutions may reflect a global sense of helplessness seen elsewhere.
articles.abstract: The outcome of Britain’s June 23 referendum is murky, but moves toward more extreme solutions may reflect a global sense of helplessness seen elsewhere.
articles.lead_paragraph: Britain may be on the cusp of having its own Donald Trump moment.

articles.headline: Inside the Clinton Team’s Plan to Defeat Donald Trump
articles.snippet: Prominent Democrats supporting Hillary Clinton are starting to consider a question many had thought they would never ask: How do we defeat Mr. Trump in a general election?
articles.abstract: Prominent Democrats supporting Hillary Clinton are starting to consider a question many had thought they would never ask: How do we defeat Mr. Trump in a general election?
articles.lead_paragraph: In the days after Donald J. Trump vanquished his Republican rivals in South Carolina and Nevada, prominent Democrats supporting Hillary Clinton arranged a series of meetings and conference calls to tackle a question many never thought they would ask: How do we defeat Mr. Trump in a general election?
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Waste in Cancer Drugs Costs $3 Billion a Year, a Study Says
articles.snippet: Many drug makers exclusively sell one-size-fits-all vials, meaning patients pay thousands for medicine they are never given, researchers say.
articles.abstract: Many drug makers exclusively sell one-size-fits-all vials, meaning patients pay thousands for medicine they are never given, researchers say.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The federal Medicare program and private health insurers waste nearly $3 billion every year buying cancer medicines that are thrown out because many drug makers distribute the drugs only in vials that hold too much for most patients, a group of cancer researchers has found.

articles.headline: Hamas Commander, Accused of Theft and Gay Sex, Is Killed by His Own
articles.snippet: The death of Mahmoud Ishtiwi, who was accused of homosexuality, had all the trappings of a soap opera: sex, torture and embezzlement, in the armed wing of Hamas.
articles.abstract: The death of Mahmoud Ishtiwi, who was accused of homosexuality, had all the trappings of a soap opera: sex, torture and embezzlement, in the armed wing of Hamas.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY — The death of Mahmoud Ishtiwi had all the trappings of a telenovela: sex, torture and embezzlement in Gaza’s most venerated and secretive institution, the armed wing of Hamas.
articles.byline: By Diaa Hadid and Majd Al Waheidi
